derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English (in sense 3): from late Latin impersonalis, from Latin in- 'not' + personalis (see personal)

entry.def: If you describe a place, organization, or activity as impersonal, you mean that it is not very friendly and makes you feel unimportant because it involves or is used by a large number of people.

example.ex: Before then many children were cared for in large impersonal orphanages...
example.tran: 在那之前,许多孩子被安置在一个缺乏人情味的大孤儿院里。

example.ex: The health service has been criticized for being too impersonal.
example.tran: 公共医疗卫生服务一向被指责缺乏人情味。

entry.tran: 客观的;不受个人感情(或偏见)影响的
entry.def: If you describe someone's behaviour as impersonal, you mean that they do not show any emotion about the person they are dealing with.

example.ex: We must be as impersonal as a surgeon with his knife...
example.tran: 我们必须像外科医生拿手术刀时一样冷静客观,不受任何感情影响。

example.ex: I gave Coe an impersonal stare.
example.tran: 我不带任何感情地盯着科。

entry.tran: 非个人的;不带个人色彩的
entry.def: An impersonal room or statistic does not give any information about the character of the person to whom it belongs or relates.

example.ex: The rest of the room was neat and impersonal...
example.tran: 房间的其余部分整洁干净,不带任何的个人色彩。

example.ex: History reduces the carnage to impersonal numbers.
example.tran: 历史叙述把大屠杀简缩成了冷冰冰的数字。

means.word_mean: 1. not relating to or responsive to individual persons;

auth_sentence.content: An economic disaster was as impersonal as an earthquake.
auth_sentence.res_content: An economic disaster was as impersonal as an earthquake.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: An economic disaster was as impersonal as an earthquake.

auth_sentence.content: Like all the other big townsssocialist, impersonal, anonymous.
auth_sentence.res_content: Like all the other big townsssocialist, impersonal, anonymous.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Like all the other big townsssocialist, impersonal, anonymous.

auth_sentence.content: Impersonal information of this sort rarely changes behavior.
auth_sentence.res_content: Impersonal information of this sort rarely changes behavior.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Impersonal information of this sort rarely changes behavior.

means.word_mean: 不受个人情感影响的,冷淡的

sentences.en: Even his children found him strangely distant and impersonal.
sentences.cn: 他的孩子们也认为他跟其他人很疏远，没有人情味。

sentences.en: His manner seemed rather stiff and impersonal.
sentences.cn: 他的态度似乎很生硬冷淡。
